name: ABORDO, Peter
bio: ABOUT THE ARTIST Peter Abordo (b. May 8, 1971, Sampaloc, Manila) is an acclaimed Filipino contemporary artist and painter specializing in visual narratives that transform everyday life into compelling fine art. This talented Filipino painter studied Fine Arts at the University of Santo Tomas, mentored by esteemed professors Tam Austria, Mario Santiago, and Butch Soriano. Following graduation, Abordo worked as a visual artist in advertising and animation studios, where his animation expertise refined his exceptional eye for detail and observation—fundamental skills that define his artistic practice. As a contemporary Filipino painter, Abordo's artworks masterfully capture the poetry of daily life through sensitive realism, elevating familiar scenes into profound visual stories that resonate deeply with art collectors and viewers alike.
description: ABOUT THE ARTIST Peter Abordo (b. As a contemporary Filipino painter, Abordo's artworks masterfully capture the poetry of daily life through sensitive realism, elevating familiar scenes into profound visual stories that resonate deeply with art collectors and viewers alike.

name: ACUNA, Ivan
bio: Ivan Acuna, a renowned Filipino contemporary artist and painter, was born in Manila on August 23, 1968. This accomplished visual artist studied Fine Arts at the University of The Philippines and expanded his artistic education through professional art workshops in Brisbane, Australia. Acuna's artistic practice emerged from studying the masterworks of celebrated Filipino National Artist Jose Joya, with additional significant influences from international modern art masters Willem De Kooning and Joan Miro. Beginning his creative career as a professional photographer, Ivan Acuna evolved into one of the most recognizable Philippine contemporary artists in the modern art scene. As a non-traditional Filipino artist and painter, he excels at collaborative artistic processes, often working with interior designers to create bespoke fine art installations.

As a non-traditional Filipino artist and painter, he excels at collaborative artistic processes, often working with interior designers to create bespoke fine art installations.

name: ALCANTARA, Tish
bio: Tish Alcantara (b. February 8, 1989) is a talented Filipino visual artist and contemporary painter specializing in anime-inspired fine art and Japonisme-influenced compositions. This emerging Filipino artist studied at the University of the Philippines College of Fine Arts, majoring in Visual Communication. Raised in an artistic family of established gallerists and professional artists, Alcantara was immersed in the Philippines' vibrant contemporary art community from childhood, surrounded by renowned creatives who cultivated her early passion for visual arts. Deeply influenced by anime culture and Japonisme aesthetics, this contemporary Filipino painter creates artworks that masterfully merge clean, graphic-like color compositions with intricate, pattern-rich details. Frequently centering on female subjects, her paintings echo the meticulous elegance of traditional kimono-making—carefully plotted and layered—transforming each portrait into a visual tapestry exploring nuanced human relationships. Beyond the studio, she draws creative inspiration from anime and video gaming, passions that continuously inform her distinctive bold visual language in contemporary Philippine art.

name: ALEGRE, Hermes
bio: ABOUT THE ARTIST Hermes Alegre, a multi-awarded Filipino contemporary artist and painter, was born in 1968 in Daet, Camarines Norte. This accomplished visual artist graduated from the Philippine Women's University with a major in Fine Arts, where he received artistic training under notable Filipino artists Ibarra dela Rosa and Mars Galang. As a celebrated contemporary Filipino painter, Alegre has earned numerous prestigious art awards throughout his distinguished career in Philippine fine arts.

As a celebrated contemporary Filipino painter, Alegre has earned numerous prestigious art awards throughout his distinguished career in Philippine fine arts.

name: ANGELES, Isab
bio: Isab Angeles is a self-taught Filipino visual artist and contemporary painter with multidisciplinary creative expertise. This accomplished self-taught artist comes from an artistic family deeply rooted in diverse creative disciplines including literary arts, music, and photography. Embracing a versatile creative spirit, Angeles has cultivated an expansive artistic skillset across multiple mediums. Her artistic journey began as a professional art consultant in the Philippine art scene, where she immersed herself in studying the creative processes, techniques, and artistic disciplines of established Filipino artists, building comprehensive knowledge in fine arts practice.
description:
Isab Angeles is a self-taught Filipino visual artist and contemporary painter with multidisciplinary creative expertise. This accomplished self-taught artist comes from an artistic family deeply rooted in diverse creative disciplines including literary arts, music, and photography. Embracing a versatile creative spirit, Angeles has cultivated an expansive artistic skillset across multiple mediums. Her artistic journey began as a professional art consultant in the Philippine art scene, where she immersed herself in studying the creative processes, techniques, and artistic disciplines of established Filipino artists, building comprehensive knowledge in fine arts practice.

Through her contemporary art practice, this Filipino painter discovered authentic self-expression and personal transformation, demonstrating that artistic reinvention is possible at any age. Angeles's artwork reflects her continuous pursuit of personal growth, with each painting representing an evolutionary step in her artistic development. Her signature style features tranquil color palettes and meditative landscape paintings designed to inspire peace and contemplation in art collectors and viewers. Through her fine art, this contemporary Filipino visual artist not only expresses her personal creative journey but also offers viewers a soothing escape and moment of tranquility through beautifully crafted paintings.

name: Antonio, Marcel
bio: Marcel Antonio (b. June 28, 1965, Manila, Philippines) is a celebrated Filipino contemporary artist and painter renowned for his figurative and narrative fine art style that masterfully blends mythology, memory, and modern life. Born to accomplished artists Angelito Antonio and Norma Belleza, this Filipino painter developed a distinctive visual language characterized by dreamlike, dramatic compositions with profound undertones of melancholy, sensuality, and existential reflection. Often described as a magic realist or pseudo-narrative Filipino artist, Antonio's paintings invite open interpretation, challenging art collectors and viewers to discover deeper meaning beyond the obvious narrative. By skillfully repurposing elements from art history and popular imagery, this contemporary Filipino painter embraces artistic quotation and appropriation as creative tools, producing fine art paintings that are simultaneously familiar and enigmatic. As a prolific visual artist, Marcel Antonio has exhibited his works extensively throughout the Philippines and internationally, establishing his reputation as one of the country's most sought-after contemporary Filipino painters in the Philippine art market.

name: BADAJOS, Nilo
bio: Nilo Badajos is an accomplished Filipino contemporary artist and painter trained in the classical figurative tradition of fine art. While this skilled Filipino painter demonstrates mastery of traditional academic painting techniques and appears to honor established artistic precedents, he is by no means confined by convention. Throughout his distinguished art career, Badajos has continuously challenged his artistic style and reinvented his craft as a contemporary Filipino artist, developing his own innovative painting techniques for rendering the human figure. As a masterful visual artist, he has achieved exceptional proficiency in the nuanced interplay of light and shadow—a hallmark of his sophisticated approach to figurative painting and fine art practice.
description:

As a masterful visual artist, he has achieved exceptional proficiency in the nuanced interplay of light and shadow—a hallmark of his sophisticated approach to figurative painting and fine art practice.

Educated in the classical figurative painting tradition, this Filipino contemporary painter demonstrates deep understanding of traditional fine art principles while refusing to be limited by them. Throughout his artistic journey, Badajos has fearlessly evolved his personal style and continuously refined his craft, pioneering unique techniques for painting the human figure with contemporary sensibility. His works showcase masterful command of the subtle interplay between light and shadow, establishing him as a distinguished visual artist in Philippine contemporary art.

name: BAGACINA, Jefferson “Love”
bio: ABOUT THE ARTIST Jefferson Bañez Bagacina, popularly known as Love Bagacina, is a celebrated Filipino contemporary artist and painter born on October 12, 1993, in Paete, Laguna—recognized as the Carving Capital of the Philippines. This talented Filipino visual artist began his artistic journey by developing a distinctive signature style featuring architectural forms infused with treasured elements of Filipino lifestyle and culture. As a contemporary Filipino painter, Love Bagacina creates vibrant fine art using whimsical house patterns combined with bold, expressive colors, bringing each masterpiece to life with energy and cultural authenticity. His paintings beautifully portray simple yet meaningful Filipino provincial lifestyles he experienced during childhood—children engaged in traditional Filipino games, vendors selling local treats, families performing daily chores, and community members sharing stories. These nostalgic childhood memories from growing up in the provinces serve as profound inspiration for his artistic practice. Love Bagacina's artworks have garnered significant recognition and prestigious awards in the Philippine art scene, including the distinguished honor "Natatanging Alagad ng Sining sa Bayan ng Paete, Laguna." His artistic journey as a Filipino contemporary painter continues to inspire art collectors and touch the hearts of audiences who appreciate authentic Filipino folk art and cultural narratives.

name: BALDEMOR, Angelo
bio: Angelo Baldemor (Lito) is a renowned Filipino contemporary artist and sculptor born on August 2, 1955 in Paete, Laguna. This innovative visual artist studied Fine Arts at FEATI University under the mentorship of esteemed Filipino artist Ibarra de la Rosa. Baldemor is internationally acclaimed for pioneering his signature art form called "PAINTURES"—a groundbreaking three-dimensional fine art technique that brilliantly transforms traditional two-dimensional paintings into sculptural relief artworks. As a multidisciplinary Filipino artist, his exceptional combination of painting and sculpture techniques, masterfully executed with intricately carved realistic details, has captured the attention of prestigious art collectors and fellow professional artists throughout the Philippine contemporary art scene and beyond.

As a multidisciplinary Filipino artist, his exceptional combination of painting and sculpture techniques, masterfully executed with intricately carved realistic details, has captured the attention of prestigious art collectors and fellow professional artists throughout the Philippine contemporary art scene and beyond.

name: BALDEMOR, Manuel
bio:
ABOUT THE ARTIST
Manuel Baldemor (b. March 26, 1947, Paete, Laguna) is a multi-faceted Filipino artist whose body of work spans painting, sculpture, printmaking, writing, and book illustration. Best known for his distinctive folk art style, his pieces are characterized by simplified geometric forms and vibrant compositions that reflect the warmth and spirit of his hometown. His art lovingly captures the essence of Paete—its people, their everyday routines, and the colorful festivities that define the community—transforming local narratives into universally resonant visual stories. Through his mastery of form and color, Baldemor has created a visual language that is both rooted in tradition and accessible to audiences around the world. 

His artistic career has extended far beyond the Philippine art scene, with international recognition earned through numerous artist-in-residence programs in countries such as Chile, Estonia, France, Israel, Japan, Singapore, Switzerland, and Portugal. His works have been widely exhibited and collected globally, further elevating the profile of Philippine art abroad. A testament to his universal appeal, UNICEF has reproduced his paintings as greeting cards distributed worldwide, allowing his imagery to touch countless lives across cultures. Whether at home or abroad, Baldemor continues to be celebrated for his ability to blend cultural heritage with a global artistic sensibility, solidifying his place as one of the Philippines’ most respected contemporary masters.

name: BANDALAN, Al
bio: Al Bandalan (b. 1955, Baybay, Leyte) is an acclaimed Filipino contemporary painter and visual artist renowned for his evocative floral paintings and garden-inspired fine art compositions. This talented Filipino artist creates stunning canvases depicting lush blooms and organic natural forms, rendered without human figures to create an atmosphere of mystery and timeless beauty. Bandalan's botanical paintings are internationally celebrated for their delicate interplay of light, fragrance-like visual quality, and dreamlike atmospheric effects. As a distinguished contemporary Filipino painter specializing in floral art, his works appeal to art collectors seeking sophisticated nature-inspired paintings and botanical fine art.

name: BANEZ, Joseph
bio: Joseph Banez, popularly known as "Otep," is a celebrated Filipino contemporary artist and painter born and raised in Paete, Laguna. While his artworks embrace a folksy aesthetic, this talented visual artist masterfully portrays humor through subjects and scenes depicting humorous daily episodes of provincial comic life in the Philippines. Significantly influenced by iconic illustrator Norman Rockwell and celebrated Filipino cartoonist Larry Alcala, Otep Banez's meticulously detailed artistic renditions combined with playful color palettes and hilarious compositional settings have distinguished his successful art career. As a contemporary Filipino painter, he is currently recognized as one of the most sought-after Pop Social Realist artists in the Philippines' vibrant contemporary art scene, appealing to art collectors who appreciate narrative Filipino art with humor and cultural authenticity.

name: BENITO, Jovan
bio: Jovan Benito, a talented self-taught Filipino painter and visual artist, hails from Pakil, Laguna, and began her professional fine art career in 2007. Married to acclaimed Filipiniana surrealist painter Jerry Morada, she started her artistic journey as an apprentice under her husband's mentorship. This emerging Filipino contemporary artist has participated in various local and international art exhibitions, steadily building her reputation in the Philippine art scene. Benito's signature artistic style features vibrant renderings of everyday scenes showcasing colorful, dynamic women in rural Philippine settings, interpreted through an unmistakable contemporary aesthetic that resonates with modern art collectors seeking authentic Filipino cultural narratives.

name: BEQUILLO, Jason
bio: Jason Bequillo (b. 1977) is a distinguished contemporary Filipino painter and visual artist renowned for his realistic oil paintings that masterfully incorporate pop culture imagery to depict everyday life and cultural themes of the Philippines. Despite facing physical challenges, this talented Filipino artist established himself as an accomplished portrait artist and painter, exploring diverse artistic mediums including charcoal, watercolor, and pastels before specializing in oil painting. As a contemporary Filipino painter, Bequillo is widely recognized for his innovative approach of blending classical realism with contemporary pop culture influences, creating highly relatable and visually engaging fine art that appeals to modern art collectors and viewers seeking contemporary Filipino art with cultural relevance.

name: BERNALDO, Melchor
bio: Melchor Bernaldo (b. March 13, 1968, Baruen, Leyte) is an accomplished self-taught Filipino artist and contemporary painter whose surreal portrait paintings of Philippine goddesses, characterized by ethereal skin tones, ornate artistic details, and vibrant color bursts, embody both divine spirituality and creative imagination. A former Marine and security guard, this Filipino visual artist discovered his artistic calling through an unlikely inspiration: a company Christmas decoration contest that ignited his lifelong passion for fine art. Without formal art education, Bernaldo immersed himself in studying borrowed art books and visiting galleries, gradually developing a deeply personal yet culturally resonant artistic style. His acclaimed series, Bathalumans, reimagines deities from Philippine mythology, transforming them into powerful icons of beauty and strength while honoring indigenous Filipino narratives. Through these contemporary artworks, this self-taught Filipino painter aspires to inspire fellow artists—demonstrating that artistic mastery requires not formal prestige, but dedication, patience, unwavering focus, and genuine passion for the creative process.

name: BERNARDINO, Danna
bio: Danna Bernardino, a talented Filipino visual artist and multidisciplinary creative, graduated with a degree in Linguistics from the University of the Philippines. This contemporary Filipino artist traces her artistic journey back to childhood, learning the fundamentals of drawing from her mother's guidance. Beginning with sketch work, Bernardino's natural artistic talent flourished into vibrant paintings, exploring various mediums including pastels, acrylic, and watercolors—some of her early artworks even graced teen magazine publications. Embracing technological advancement in the arts, this versatile Filipino painter ventured into digital art, skillfully blending traditional techniques with contemporary innovation. Two years ago, she embarked on a sculptural journey, seeking more dimensional, tangible, and tactile artistic mediums to express her creativity. What began as a curiosity-driven hobby has evolved into a profound and enduring passion, establishing her as a multifaceted Filipino artist working across painting, digital art, and sculpture.

name: BERNARDO, Jacob
bio: Jacob Bernardo (b. February 3, 1979, Quezon City) is an innovative Filipino visual artist and storyteller who masterfully brings imagined worlds to life through intricately crafted diorama art made predominantly from everyday found objects. Drawing creative inspiration from history, folklore, literature, film, illustration, and the iconic worlds of DC and Marvel comics, this contemporary Filipino artist creates miniature universes where fantasy and reality seamlessly collide. Each meticulously constructed diorama scene presents boundless narrative loops—Superman encountering a manananggal, The Mandalorian in pursuit, or eerie dolls inhabiting Manila's urban shanty towns—artistically blurring boundaries between time, place, and dimension. Through these carefully constructed sculptural boxes and mixed-media installations, Bernardo invites art collectors and viewers to explore, wonder, and immerse themselves in imaginative realms where entertainment meets artistic awe, and where life's absurdity can be both contemplated and, within these miniature worlds, creatively controlled.

name: CAGANDAHAN, Glen
bio: Glenn Cagandahan is an accomplished Filipino sculptor and contemporary artist specializing in folk imagery and cultural subjects, renowned for his innovative use of diverse artistic mediums. Trained at the prestigious College of Fine Arts of the University of the Philippines, this versatile Filipino visual artist skillfully transitions between traditional sculptural materials including wood, metal, stone, terracotta, and glass, to contemporary materials such as resin, fiberglass, plastics, and ready-made objects. As a contemporary Filipino sculptor, Cagandahan's artistic practice seeks to establish a unique Philippine cultural identity through his fine art sculptures, authentically expressing Filipino folk life and faithfully simulating the Philippine rural scene through three-dimensional artworks that resonate with art collectors seeking culturally significant Philippine contemporary sculpture.
description:
Glenn Cagandahan is a sculptor of folk imagery and subjects known for his use of different mediums, shifting from traditional materials like wood, metal, stone, terracotta, glass to modern materials like resin, fiberglass, plastics and ready-mades. Trained at the College of Fine Arts of the University of the Philippines, Cagandahan’s work seeks to establish a unique cultural identity through his art, expressing folk life and simulating the Philippine rural scene.

A product of University of the Philippines College of Fine Arts majoring in Sculpture, Glenn Cagandahan is consistent winner in the national art competition Art Association of the Philippines from 2004 to 2007, winning Second Prize 2006 in Sculpture Category. In May of 2008 he was internationally auctioned at Borobudur Auction House for his sculpture ‘Best friends’ and was successfully sold. He is currently teaching Humanities 2 at the University of the Philippines Los Baños. Glenn aims “to improve and mobilize the present level of production in sculpture making” in order to enrich Philippine Sculpture as an entire heritage complete with its own cultural identification.

The present works showcase Cagandahan’s drive to assimilate new methods and materials into the heart of Philippine Sculpture. The sculptor answers the call of changing times and technologies, signaling the shift from traditional sculpture materials like wood, metal, stone, terra-cotta, glass, to modern materials like resin, fiberglass, plastics, and ready-mades. His studied technique informs the expressionist use of epoxy clay generously endowed upon steel armatures. Old matter sloughs off to proceed to the new.

Meanwhile, old themes grow in complication and expressive force – for Cagandahan likewise projects upon Philippine Sculpture various innovations of form. The dreamy melt of Dali’s paint and the severe attenuations of Giacometti’s structures find voluptuous convergence in the folksy proportions of his earth spirits, guitar players, and carabao riders. These current results linger in the eye with eerie yet genial stillness. Unfamiliar shapes greet us, but we are brought back home.

name: CAINTO, Caroline
bio: Caroline Cainto, a talented Filipino contemporary painter and visual artist, was born on November 20, 1979, and received artistic mentorship from her husband, accomplished Filipino artist Ronnel Cainto. Recognized for her striking abstractions of flora and fauna, this contemporary Filipino painter demonstrates exceptional flair for transforming natural landscapes into lyrical and expressive fine art compositions. Her paintings are beautifully sophisticated artistic essays in harmonious composition where vibrant color takes creative precedence over traditional drawing techniques, creating visually stunning artworks that appeal to art collectors seeking contemporary Filipino abstract art with natural themes.
description: Caroline Cainto, a talented Filipino contemporary painter and visual artist, was born on November 20, 1979, and received artistic mentorship from her husband, accomplished Filipino artist Ronnel Cainto. Recognized for her striking abstractions of flora and fauna, this contemporary Filipino painter demonstrates exceptional flair for transforming natural landscapes into lyrical and expressive fine art compositions. Her paintings are deceptively simple yet highly sophisticated artistic essays in harmonious composition where vibrant color takes creative precedence over traditional drawing techniques, creating visually stunning artworks that appeal to art collectors seeking contemporary Filipino abstract art with natural themes.

name: CAINTO, Ronnel
bio: Ronnel Cainto is a distinguished Filipino contemporary sculptor and painter whose artistic heritage stems from a proud lineage of renowned wood carvers in Paete, Laguna. Born on May 28, 1978, this talented Filipino visual artist began his creative journey as an assistant to his father, who expertly sculpted religious puon sculptures that served as the family's primary income source. As a contemporary Filipino artist, his sculptural works are significantly influenced by Mexican folk art aesthetics and nostalgic throwbacks to his childhood favorite, Gumby. Ronnel masterfully maintains a distinctive tone of simplicity throughout his artistic creations through the strategic use of limited yet bold color palettes, creating visually impactful fine art sculptures and paintings that resonate with art collectors seeking authentic Philippine contemporary art.
description: Ronnel Cainto is a distinguished Filipino contemporary sculptor and painter whose artistic heritage stems from a proud lineage of renowned wood carvers in Paete, Laguna. As a contemporary Filipino artist, his sculptural works are significantly influenced by Mexican folk art aesthetics and nostalgic throwbacks to his childhood favorite, Gumby. Ronnel masterfully maintains a distinctive tone of simplicity throughout his artistic creations through the strategic use of limited yet bold color palettes, creating visually impactful fine art sculptures and paintings that resonate with art collectors seeking authentic Philippine contemporary art.

name: CARLOS, Isagani Punzalan
bio: Isagani Carlos is a distinguished contemporary Filipino painter and visual artist renowned for his refined mastery of oil on canvas, where he skillfully weaves expressive forms, richly layered textures, and evocative moods into compelling fine art compositions. His artistic works, ranging from intimate portrait paintings to impressive large-scale canvases, reveal a sophisticated balance of technical finesse and emotional depth, frequently highlighting the elegance of human form and the organic richness of natural motifs. Through his contemporary paintings, this talented Filipino artist creates a meaningful dialogue between classical realism and abstract expressionism, inviting art collectors and viewers into a deeply personal yet universally resonant artistic experience that showcases exceptional skill in Philippine contemporary fine art.

name: CASTRILLO, Ronald
bio: Ronald Castrillo (b. June 3, 1964) is a distinguished Filipino contemporary artist and sculptor known for his unique fusion of engineering precision and artistic creativity. Born into an artistic family—his parents Aurea and Amado Castrillo were accomplished writers, illustrators, and sculptors—this Filipino visual artist developed a passion for fine arts from an early age. With a Bachelor of Science degree in Aeronautical Engineering, majoring in Aircraft Design from PATTS School of Aeronautics, Castrillo masterfully combines technical knowledge with sculptural artistry. As a contemporary Filipino sculptor, his innovative approach merges engineering principles with creative expression, creating distinctive sculptures and fine art pieces that have established him as one of the premier sculptors of his generation in Philippine contemporary art.

As a contemporary Filipino sculptor, his innovative approach merges engineering principles with creative expression, creating distinctive sculptures and fine art pieces that have established him as one of the premier sculptors of his generation in Philippine contemporary art.

name: CONMIGO, Reymar
bio: Reymar Conmigo (b. October 30, 1967, Parañaque) is a talented Filipino contemporary artist and painter specializing in cubist fine art with nature-inspired themes. From a young age, this Filipino visual artist actively participated in various art competitions, cultivating his artistic skills and passion for painting. After working as an Auto Repair Shop Service Manager, Conmigo was encouraged by renowned Filipino artists Hermes Alegre and Loreto Racuya to return to his true calling in the arts. As a contemporary Filipino painter, his cubist artworks feature a distinctive stylistic edge with carefully defined compositions showcasing his signature leaf motif rendered in varied colors and intricate patterns. His contemporary paintings masterfully explore the magnificent beauty of nature, capturing rare natural spectacles and immortalizing them on canvas with geometric precision that appeals to art collectors seeking modern Filipino cubist art.

name: CUNANAN, Lemuel
bio: Lemuel Cunanan (b. August 27, 1974) is a self-taught Filipino contemporary artist and painter specializing in airbrush techniques, oil painting, and acrylic fine art. As an accomplished self-taught airbrush artist and visual designer, this Filipino painter has distinguished himself through active participation in prestigious art competitions across the Philippines. An avid competitor in the Philippine art scene, Cunanan has won numerous local art awards and recognitions. This contemporary Filipino painter's signature artistic style focuses on classical realism masterfully blended with elements of fantasy and rich cultural influences from Philippine heritage. His paintings demonstrate highly developed expertise in color theory, composition, scale, and surface treatment, frequently achieved through the use of subtly subdued tones and complex multi-layered compositions that appeal to art collectors seeking sophisticated realist and fantasy Filipino fine art.

name: DELOLA, Angelo
bio: Angelo M. Delola (b. October 29, 1972, Murphy, Cubao, Quezon City) is a Filipino visual artist and sculptor who earned his Fine Arts degree, major in Advertising, from Far Eastern University in 1993. After years working as a full-time graphics artist—including his last post at Viva Entertainment—and writing unpublished novels and vlogging as “KIDLAP,” he shifted entirely to art during the pandemic in 2022, quickly becoming active in exhibitions across Metro Manila and beyond. Delola is known for pioneering “scrapture,” a sculptural method that transforms discarded objects—broken toys, mechanical fragments, and obsolete electronics—into meticulously finished works that evoke ancient metal artifacts. His aesthetic merges steampunk machinery, Art Nouveau curves, and speculative organic forms, creating hybrid figures and structures that appear like relics from an alternate world. Guided by his belief that art is shaped by Consciousness rather than the artist alone, Delola views himself as a vessel through which creation moves, grounding a practice where the forgotten becomes permanent and the disposable becomes meaningful.

name: DELOS SANTOS, Roland
bio: Born in 1952 in Tanay Rolando Delos Santos is a still life artist whose passion for art ignited during his elementary years. He found inspiration in the works of talented illustrators such as FC Javinal, Nestor Redondo, Angel Cacnio, Tony Carabana, Alex Nino and Larry Alcala. Spending countless hours copying their comic illustrations, this became his training and favorite pastime. From 1975 to 1980, Delos Santos studied under Ibarra de la Rosa at FEATI, and his recent works center on antique Chinese Jars and he aimed to create a series that would resemble a collection under glass. He drew inspiration from his own collection of antique jars and some references from Christie’s and Sotheby’s catalogs. His artistic journey also includes influences from artist like Tam Austria and Andrew Wyeth. He was a part of the Tanay Group that was founded in 1975 with artists such as Martin Catolos, Joni and Charley Pagalunan, Crispin Agno, Rustico Timtiman, and Nestor Villarosa. Even if the art scene changes he continues to find inspiration in Tanay’s landscapes. To him Tanay’s scenery remains a rich source of inspiration, even as the town evolves.

name: DEMATERA, Bullet
bio: Ronald “Bullet” Dematera is a Filipino self-taught hyperrealist painter renowned for his intricate fusion of realism, surrealism, and pop art. Born and raised in Bulacan, he faced early challenges, including a cleft palate and limited formal education, which led him to work from a young age. Despite these obstacles, his passion for art remained unwavering. At 20, he began working as a studio assistant, eventually apprenticing under renowned artist Ronald Ventura for nearly a decade. This mentorship honed his skills in graphite, oil, and acrylic painting, allowing him to develop a distinctive style characterized by vibrant textures and dreamlike compositions that intertwine nature, florals, humans, and animals. His works often explore the complex relationship between humanity and the natural world, conveying themes of beauty, resilience, and introspection. Dematera's art has been featured in numerous solo exhibitions, including The Unspoken Wilderness and Menagerie, and his pieces have garnered recognition in the art community. His journey from adversity to artistic acclaim serves as a testament to his resilience and dedication to his craft.

name: DIZON, Jeff
bio: Jeff Dizon (b. February 4, 1954) is a celebrated Filipino contemporary visual artist, best known for his modern expressionist works that combine highly detailed, ornate line work with richly colored figures and symbolic concepts. A graduate of the University of the Philippines and a distinguished scholar, Dizon’s talent was recognized early on by mentors, including National Artist Jose Joya. Over the decades, he has mounted numerous solo exhibitions and garnered awards that affirm his mastery and innovation in painting. His skill, techniques, and profound artistic expression have been highly praised by critics, scholars, and collectors alike, securing his place as one of the most respected figures in contemporary Philippine art.

name: DORONIO, Rico
bio: Rico Doronio (b. February 17, 1966, Borbon, Cebu) is a talented Filipino contemporary artist and painter known for his vibrant landscape and figurative artworks. This accomplished Filipino visual artist studied at Makati Polytechnic Community College, where he placed first in the First Tubig Pangkulay art competition during his freshman year, showcasing early artistic talent. Trained by his brother-in-law, renowned Filipino artist Antonio Mahilum, Doronio assisted Mahilum in executing the impressive mural commissioned by Allied Bank for its main office at Ayala Avenue, gaining valuable professional artistic experience. In 1989, this emerging Filipino painter joined the established stable of artists under Heritage Art Center, marking a significant milestone in his art career. Doronio presented his first solo exhibition in 1997, establishing himself as a contemporary Filipino painter in the Philippine fine arts community with artworks that resonate with art collectors seeking authentic Filipino contemporary paintings.

name: GEDUSPAN, Anthony
bio: Anthony Geduspan (b. October 20, 1978, Guimbal, Iloilo) is a self-taught Filipino contemporary artist and painter specializing in cubist fine art and contemporary abstract paintings. This talented Filipino visual artist graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering from the Western Institute of Technology, demonstrating versatility in both technical and creative fields. Geduspan began his serious artistic journey at age 19, developing his painting skills without formal fine arts training by studying art magazines and learning from senior Filipino artists. As a contemporary Filipino painter, he developed a special artistic interest in cubism, adding his own distinctive flavor by experimenting with innovative combinations of hues and contrasts. His cubist paintings feature bold geometric forms and vibrant color palettes that appeal to art collectors seeking modern Filipino abstract and cubist contemporary art.

name: GOMEZ, Ray
bio: Ray Gomez (b. 1962, Nasugbu, Batangas) is a Filipino hyperrealist painter celebrated for his extraordinary still-life works, particularly his meticulous depictions of rice. Known for his near-photographic precision, Gomez transforms an everyday staple into a powerful symbol of Filipino identity, culture, and sustenance. His artistry lies in the painstaking detail of each grain, rendered with astonishing clarity and reverence, elevating the ordinary into the profound. Highly recognized by fellow artists and collectors, his works showcase both technical mastery and cultural depth, making him a distinctive figure in Philippine hyperrealism.

name: HIPOLITO, Dante
bio: Dante Hipolito is a celebrated Filipino hyperrealist painter and contemporary artist renowned for his distinctive portrait paintings featuring heartfelt smiles, earning him the distinguished title "The Smile Painter" in the Philippine art scene. This accomplished Filipino visual artist fearlessly experiments with various artistic techniques, synergizing all his influences and knowledge to evolve a self-developed style—a unique take on hyperrealism that has become his artistic signature. As a contemporary Filipino painter, Hipolito's technical mastery and artistic vision gained international recognition when he was commissioned by the Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines in 2015 to create a special painting as a gift for the Papal visit. This prestigious commission featured high-profile personalities wearing traditional farm clothes rendered in vibrant rural realism, showcasing his ability to blend hyperrealist technique with Filipino cultural themes. His paintings appeal to art collectors seeking authentic Filipino hyperrealist contemporary art with emotional depth and cultural resonance.

name: HIPOLITO, Ella
bio: Ella Hipolito is a talented Filipino visual artist, art director, and innovative coffee artist based in San Mateo, Rizal. This accomplished Filipino contemporary artist earned her degree in Fine Arts, majoring in Advertising, from the College of the Holy Spirit, Mendiola, Manila, establishing her foundation in both commercial and fine arts. As a multidisciplinary creative professional and freelance Filipino artist, Hipolito's expertise spans creative concept development, art direction, graphic design, and various forms of visual and manual crafts. Her artistic practice demonstrates particular innovation in using coffee as a creative medium, producing unique coffee paintings, bean mosaics, assemblage art, and sculptures that showcase her versatility as a contemporary Filipino artist working across traditional and experimental mediums.
description:
Ella Hipolito is a Filipino art director and coffee artist based in San Mateo, Rizal. She earned her degree in Fine Arts, major in Advertising, from the College of the Holy Spirit, Mendiola, Manila.

A freelance artist, Hipolito’s skills span creative concept development, art direction, graphic design, and various forms of visual and manual crafts. Her passion for animals and nature often informs her artistic sensibility.

Known for her imaginative use of coffee as a medium, Hipolito creates works ranging from coffee paintings and bean mosaics to t-shirt and stone art, assemblage, and sculpture. Her art often supports charitable causes through exhibitions and personal advocacy projects.

Her work has been featured in The Philippine Star, Manila Bulletin, Mega Magazine, DDG, and various television programs including DZMM Teleradyo, GMA’s I Juander, and Net25 Landmarks.

Hipolito held her first solo exhibition, Coffee Creativity: The Many Colors and Textures of Coffee, in 2012, followed by Coffee Creativity: By Request in 2013. She continues to participate in group exhibitions and is known for introducing new and inventive concepts in each show.

name: Hablo, Allain
bio: Allain Hablo (b. April 1968, Estancia, Iloilo) is a Filipino abstract and mixed-media artist recognized for his textured surfaces and meditations on healing, resilience, and time. Moving from figuration to abstraction, Hablo developed a language of cracks, joins, and metallic lusters inspired by the Japanese art of kintsugi, where brokenness becomes beauty. Working with wood, canvas, and even stainless steel sheets, he manipulates materials by burning, scoring, and layering pigments, creating compositions that balance austerity with radiance. His works, often described as industrial yet spiritual, embody a quiet strength that transforms imperfection into a powerful metaphor for human endurance.

name: LIAO, Ed
bio: Ed Liao (b. May 6, 1962, Cebu City) is an accomplished Filipino contemporary artist and abstract painter whose artistic journey evolved from realism to Zen-inspired abstraction. This talented Filipino visual artist studied Fine Arts, majoring in painting, at the University of the Philippines Cebu and completed his bachelor's degree at UP Diliman, establishing a strong foundation in Philippine fine arts education. Beginning his art career as a realist painter influenced by his mentor, esteemed Filipino artist Jose Blanco, Liao later evolved into abstract expressionism, incorporating philosophical principles of Zen Buddhism into his contemporary artistic practice. As a contemporary Filipino painter specializing in abstract art, he has mounted six solo exhibitions showcasing his unique fusion of Eastern philosophy and modern painting techniques. His current mural works are exhibited at prestigious venues including Robinsons Cybergate, demonstrating his versatility as both a studio artist and public muralist working in Philippine contemporary abstract art.

name: LIM, Sven Wilbur
bio: Sven Lim (b. November 23, 1988, Iba, La Loma, Quezon City), known as “Living Pages,” is a Filipino artist who transforms discarded books into intricate sculptural works where text, form, and engineering converge. A graduate of FEU East Asia College and a former robotic arm engineer, Lim is a self-taught creator whose practice involves carving figures from dismantled pages and reattaching them onto the book to suggest words coming alive. His technical background informs the precision and durability of his pieces, which are preserved through resin and clear varnish, aiming to evoke calm and delight in both private and public spaces. His work has been showcased at the CCP Pasinaya Festival and the NCCA Arts Month 2025, and he received 2nd place in the Watson’s Re-Imagine Recycle Art Competition, with one of his sculptures included in the collection of Ryan Cayabyab.

name: MAHILUM, Anton
bio: Anton Mahilum is a talented Filipino contemporary artist and landscape painter specializing in nature-inspired sceneries depicting the simplicity and tranquility of rural Philippine life. This accomplished Filipino visual artist's preferred subjects include serene small streams and rivers where carefree children play, capturing idyllic moments of provincial Filipino childhood. As a contemporary Filipino painter, his signature artistic style initially featured cool and calm color palettes rendered in realist painting techniques. The remarkable artistic evolution of this Filipino landscape painter is evident in his current works, where he boldly employs iridescent colors that dramatically contrast with his rural subjects and themes. His contemporary paintings create a distinctive artistic style that masterfully bridges modern and traditional aesthetics, appealing to art collectors seeking vibrant Filipino landscape paintings with both realist foundations and contemporary color innovation.

name: MAHILUM, Joel
bio: Joel Mahilum (b. March 18, 1974) is an accomplished Filipino contemporary artist and figurative painter known for his contemplative portrayals of childhood subjects. This talented Filipino visual artist studied at the prestigious University of the Philippines College of Fine Arts, receiving comprehensive training in Philippine fine arts education. As the second son of master Filipino artist Tony Mahilum, Joel was naturally immersed in an artistic family environment where creative expression flourished. As a contemporary Filipino painter, he distinguished himself by painting children with a tranquil, pensive mood rather than the energetic demeanor typically portrayed by other artists. His signature artistic style features modern, stylized textures that lightly contrast with quiet, focused subjects, creating a serene atmosphere of innocence beautifully captured on canvas. His contemplative paintings appeal to art collectors seeking Filipino contemporary figurative art with emotional depth and peaceful aesthetics.

name: MALLARI, Ram
bio: Ram Mallari Jr. (b. 1966, Bataan, Philippines) is a Filipino sculptor widely recognized as the country’s “Father of Steampunk Art.” Transforming discarded industrial scrap into intricate retrofuturistic works, his reclaimed sculptures explore resilience, sustainability, and the tension between past and future. With a background in architecture and drafting, Mallari rose to prominence through major exhibitions and public commissions such as The Last Tree at Ayala Nuvali and the life-size steampunk Lapu-Lapu at Camp Crame. Featured on the cover of World Sculpture News in 2015 and in global outlets like The Washington Post and BBC, he continues to push boundaries with ambitious projects including the forthcoming Fort Malasimbo Museum, envisioned to showcase his largest and most innovative works.

name: MARQUEZ, Oliver
bio: Oliver Marquez (b. April 30, 1974, Angeles City) is a resilient self-taught Filipino contemporary artist and painter whose artistic journey demonstrates remarkable determination and creative triumph. Born into a family of artists who created scales and wildlife art sold as tourist art, this Filipino visual artist was displaced to Malolos, Bulacan due to the Mt. Pinatubo volcanic eruption. Despite aspiring to study fine arts, financial constraints led him to pursue drafting at Bulacan State University instead. As an entrepreneurial artist, Marquez opened a sign shop but stepped away from painting for 10 years. In 2011, encouraged by a supportive friend, this contemporary Filipino painter returned to his artistic calling and began actively competing in prestigious Philippine art competitions. His remarkable comeback resulted in winning three grand prizes from PAGCOR National Art Competition, AAP on-the-spot contest, and Gov. Ejercito's Pagsanjan Art Competition, establishing himself as an accomplished award-winning Filipino contemporary artist whose paintings resonate with art collectors seeking authentic Filipino artistic narratives of perseverance and creative excellence.

name: MARTINEZ, Raymart
bio: Raymart Martinez is a contemporary Filipino painter whose expressive acrylic compositions celebrate familial bonds, everyday moments, and festive scenes. His works, often warm and evocative, include titles such as A Gift from the Heart, Lovers Series, Mother and Child, Fruit Vendors, and Pagdiriwang Sa Gitna Ng Gintong Ani (“Celebration Amidst the Golden Harvest”) — each piece capturing the richness of Filipino life through dynamic color palettes and intimate forms.

name: MONNAR
bio: Monnar’s art is characterized by using bright and vibrant colors in his organic and graphical paintings. His subjects and characters are drawn in an outline of distorted and exaggerated style, embellished in an array of different inking techniques. He prefers to work with Pen, Ink with Acrylic, and his earlier career as a comic creator has allowed him to easily conceptualize ideas and editorial topics and tackle different subject matters. Monnar has exhibited in several shows, including the show “Preview: Adieu!” at the Galerie Menouar in Paris, which was met with critical acclaim. He is a versatile artist who works across various mediums, and his unique style and approach to art continue to captivate audiences around the world.

Monnar Baldemor is a talented Filipino artist known for his unique style of Surrealist Expressionism. He was born on February 14, 1970, in Paete, Laguna, and pursued his education at the University of the East, where he majored in Advertising. Monnar’s father, Manuel Baldemor, is a renowned artist, but Monnar has chosen to carve out his own niche in the art world.

name: MONTOYA, Manuel
bio: Manuel Montoya (b. 1959, Davao City) is an accomplished Filipino contemporary artist and painter known for his distinctive impressionist style influenced by European Impressionism and Japanese art aesthetics. This talented Filipino visual artist studied at the University of Mindanao, majoring in Bachelor of Secondary Education (BSED), and furthered his artistic education through a correspondence course in Art Studies at London's International Correspondence School. During the 1980s, Montoya co-founded the Davao Art Foundation alongside fellow Filipino artists George So, Lito Pepito, and Jun Alfon, contributing significantly to the development of the Mindanao contemporary art scene. As a contemporary Filipino painter, his artistic breakthrough came when he met Tito Sausu in Davao, a classmate of renowned Filipino artist Zalameda at the University of Santo Tomas. Sausu's extensive collection of art books on design principles and color theory philosophies inspired Montoya to develop his own innovative color theory. His signature artistic style focuses on searching for and combining clear, clean, and pure colors, creating vibrant impressionist paintings that appeal to art collectors seeking Filipino contemporary art with European and Asian influences.

name: MORADA, Jerry
bio: Jerry Morada (b. 1979, Paete, Laguna) is a Filipino sculptor and painter known for merging traditional craftsmanship with contemporary finishes. A Fine Arts graduate of the University of the Philippines Diliman, he began carving under the guidance of his father, a Paete woodcarver, and has since worked in marble, wood, and even ice, often finishing his sculptures with automotive paint to create a modern yet organic look. His works—ranging from robust animal forms to nostalgic, history-inspired pieces—have earned recognition in major competitions like the GSIS National Art Competition. Morada’s art reflects a deep respect for anatomical form, folk heritage, and the quiet strength of enduring traditions.

name: MORALES, Adrian
bio: Adrian Morales (b. September 6, 1971) is a talented Filipino contemporary artist and painter with a unique background blending engineering and fine arts. This accomplished Filipino visual artist studied Engineering at Notre Dame College before pursuing his passion for contemporary painting. As a member of the Artist Society, Morales was introduced to Philippine National Artist Cesar Legaspi by his uncle, William Yu, gaining invaluable mentorship from one of the country's most respected modernist painters. This contemporary Filipino painter worked under Inday Cadapan, a devoted follower of modernist masters Miro and Picasso, further refining his artistic foundation. However, Morales' strongest artistic attraction developed toward Ferdinand Leger, whose works are heavily influenced by Aztec patterns and geometric forms. As a contemporary Filipino painter specializing in cubist and geometric abstraction, his present artistic style reflects this inspiration, creating bold contemporary paintings that fuse Aztec-inspired patterns with modern cubist techniques, appealing to art collectors seeking Filipino contemporary art with international modernist influences.
